StormR 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Compute indicators of storm behaviour

    stormBehaviour_sp.Rd

    This function computes/rasterizes analytic products for each storm of a Storms object, including Maximum Sustained Wind, Power Dissipation Index, Category exposure and 2D wind speed structures of wind speed for every observations

    stormBehaviour_sp(
  sts,
  product = "MSW",
  wind_threshold = c(18, 33, 42, 49, 58, 70),
  method = "Willoughby",
  asymmetry = "Boose01",
  empirical_rmw = FALSE,
  space_res = "2.5min",
  time_res = 1,
  verbose = 2
)

    Arguments

    sts

    Storms object

    product

    character. Product to compute that is either

    • "MSW", Maximum Sustained Wind

    • "PDI", Power Dissipation Index

    • "Exposure", hours spent for each and all categories together

    • "Profiles", 2D wind speed structures of wind speed with wind direction for each observation

    Default value is set to "MSW"

    wind_threshold

    numeric vector. ...

    method

    character. Cyclonic model used to compute product, that is either

    • "Willoughby"

    • "Holland"

    Default value is set to "Willoughby"

    asymmetry

    character. Indicates which version of asymmetry to use in the computations, that is either

    • "None", no asymmetry

    • "Boose01", first version

    Default value is set to "None".

    empirical_rmw

    logical. Whether to compute the Radius of Maximum Wind empirically, according to getRmw function or using the Radius of Maximum Wind from the observations. Default value is set to FALSE

    space_res

    character. Space resolution for the raster(s) to compute. Either 30sec, 2.5min, 5min or 10min. Default value is set to 30sec

    time_res

    numeric. Period of time (hours) used to compute the analytic raster(s). Allowed values are 1 (60min), 0.75 (45min), 0.5 (30min), and 0.25 (15min). Default value is set to 1

    verbose

    numeric. Either 0, 1, 2 or 3. Whether or not the function must be verbose and display informations about the process and/or outputs and notes.

    • 0 Nothing is displayed

    • 1 Informations about the process are displayed

    • 2 Outputs are also displayed

    • 3 Additional notes are displayed

    Default value is set to 2

    Value

    ...

    Examples

    #Compute MSW for PAM 2015 in Vanuatu using default settings
msw_pam <- stormBehaviour_sp(pam)
#> === stormBehaviour_sp processing ... ===
#> 
#> Computation settings:
#>   (*) Time interpolation: Every 60 min
#>   (*) Space resolution: 2.5min 
#>   (*) Method used: Willoughby 
#>   (*) Product(s) to compute: MSW 
#>   (*) Asymmetry used: Boose01 
#> 
#> Storm(s):
#>   ( 1 )  PAM 
#> 
#> PAM  ( 1 / 1 )
#>

#Compute PDI for ERICA and NIRAN in New Caledonia using Holland model without asymmetry
pdi_nc <- stormBehaviour_sp(sts_nc, time_res = 0.5, method = "Holland",
                        product = "PDI")

#> 
#> Output:
#> SpatRaster stack with 6 layers:
#> index - name of layers
#>   1     PAM_Exposure_18 
#>   2     PAM_Exposure_33

#>   5     PAM_Exposure_58 
#>   6     PAM_Exposure_70

#Compute profiles wind speed for ERICA and NIRAN in New Caledonia using default settings
prof_nc <- stormBehaviour_sp(sts_nc, product = "Profiles")
#> === stormBehaviour_sp processing ... ===
#> 
#> Computation settings:
#>   (*) Time interpolation: Every 60 min
#>   (*) Space resolution: 2.5min 
#>   (*) Method used: Willoughby 
#>   (*) Product(s) to compute: Profiles 
#>   (*) Asymmetry used: Boose01
